intro: Climacoptera bucharica, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically blooms in the summer months, producing vibrant pink or red flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branched. Climacoptera bucharica is adapted to harsh mountain environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun exposure.
